qas.question: What was the other city in the running to become capital of Mexico?
What part of the constitution established the right to create a capital city?
When was the federal constitution signed?
What type of land is Mexico City?
Who is in charge of the land of Mexico City according to the original constitution?

context: The Acta Constitutiva de la Federación of January 31, 1824, and the Federal Constitution of <a2_0>October 4, 1824<a2_0/>, fixed the political and administrative organization of the United Mexican States after the Mexican War of Independence. In addition, <a1_0>Section XXVIII of Article 50<a1_0/> gave the new Congress the right to choose where the federal government would be located. This location would then be appropriated as <a3_0>federal<a3_0/> land, with the <a4_0>federal government<a4_0/> acting as the local authority. The two main candidates to become the capital were Mexico City and <a0_0>Querétaro<a0_0/>.
